title: Chi-Square Conditions
question_text:
A student at a large high school suspects that Ms. Smith is grading her students too leniently. Over the past $5$ years, the grade distribution (given in proportions) of students in all sections of statistics (taught by many different teachers) is below:
GradeABCDE
Percent$20$%$30$%$30$%$10$%$10$%
A simple random sample of $80$ students who took statistics with Ms. Smith over the past $5$ years is taken and results in the following grade distribution:
GradeABCDE
Percent$40$%$30$%$20$%$8$%$2$%
Which of the following conditions must be met before the student can use a $\chi^2$ procedure in this situation?

choices.text: The distribution of grades in all sections must be approximately Normal.
The number of categories must be small relative to the number of students sampled.

All observed counts must be greater than
5
.

Each observation must be randomly selected from the population of all of Ms. Smith's students from the past
5
years.
All expected counts must be approximately equal.
